p.s: I want to share something with you
I used to feel nervous about English
Words, grammar, even simple sentences – they confused me
I opened grammar books and felt lost
Sometimes I wanted to give up
I thought, “Maybe English is too hard for me”
Or, “Maybe I’m not good at languages”
But then something small changed everything
From that day, I stopped fighting with grammar
And I started to understand it
Now, I want to tell you how that happened
Let’s go on this new journey together
Back in school, my teacher always said
But those rules felt too difficult
Future perfect, present continuous … so many names
I memorized the rules for tests
And then I forgot them the next day
I felt like I couldn’t do it
Sometimes I didn’t want to try
I believed grammar was only for clever students
But deep down, I still had a dream
I wanted to speak English clearly
I just needed a new way to learn
One afternoon, I walked into the library
But then I saw a man reading a grammar book
He said, “Yes. I play with it”
“I use stories. I try fun ideas. I don’t only study rules”
That was the moment I felt something
I went home and smiled at my grammar book
I picked up a notebook and wrote
The next day, I tried the past tense
I was using my real life
I started talking to myself in English
It sounds funny, but it helped
I asked, “What did I do today”
I watched English videos with subtitles
I copied the way they spoke
I didn’t pay for big classes
Learn one small thing every day
They are like small pieces of a puzzle
Nouns – people and things: teacher, book, dog
Adverbs – how we do something: slowly, well
Prepositions – show place or time: in, at, on
Conjunctions – join words: and, but, or
Interjections – show feelings: wow, hey, oh no
I didn’t try to remember them all
I played with them in silly sentences
The blue cat danced on the table and sang loudly”
That sentence had almost all parts of grammar
So let me tell you this
You don’t have to be perfect
You just have to stay curious
Grammar is not only for tests
It helps you say what you feel
When someone says grammar is boring
Because I know grammar gives me power
Just take one small step today
One day, someone will ask you
